contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | name = Junko Noda | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people. Non-free and "fair use" images, e.g. promo photos, CD/DVD covers, posters, screen captures, etc., will be deleted - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1971|6|29}} | birth_place = [[Naniwa-ku, Osaka|Naniwa-ku]], [[Osaka, Osaka|Osaka]], [[Osaka Prefecture]], Japan | death_date = | death_place = | other_names = | occupation = [[Seiyū|voice actress]], singer | years_active = 1993-present | spouse = | partner = | website = }} {{nihongo|'''Junko Noda'''|野田 順子|Noda Junko|born June 29, 1971 in [[Naniwa-ku, Osaka]], Japan}} is a Japanese [[Seiyū|voice actress]]. Noda is formerly affiliated with [[Aoni Production]]. In addition, Noda is part of the Hinata Girls and she is best known for her work in the ''[[Love Hina]]'' [[anime]] series. She is well known too for her various roles in the anime and manga series [[One Piece]]. == Voice Role Statistics == === Notable Roles === * [[List of Bleach characters#Tatsuki Arisawa|Tatsuki Arisawa]], '''Shun'ō''' - ''[[Bleach (manga)|Bleach]]'' * '''Takano Mizuki''' - ''[[Boys Be|Boys Be...]]'' (2000) * '''Milly''' - ''[[Daphne in the Brilliant Blue]]'' (2004) * [[Eisuke Hondou]] - ''[[Case Closed|Detective Conan]]'' * '''Tamako Harakawa''' - ''[[Dennō Coil]]'' * '''[[Veemon]]''' - ''[[Digimon|Digimon 02]]'' * [[Royal Knights#Magnamon|Magnamon]] - ''[[Digital Monster X-Evolution]]'' * '''Shouta''' - ''[[Digimon Xros Wars: Time Traveling Hunter Boys|Digimon Xros Wars: The Young Hunters Who Leapt Through Time]] * '''Saichou''' - ''[[Flame of Recca]]'' * '''Nanaho Kinjo''' - ''[[Gokujo Seitokai]]'' (2005) * '''Miyabi Aizawa''' - ''[[Great Teacher Onizuka]]'' (1999) * '''Joshua Langren''' - ''[[Gun X Sword]]'' * '''Matsuri Kato''' - ''[[Gunparade March]]'' * '''Reki''' - ''[[Haibane Renmei]]'' (2002) * '''Maho Izawa''' - ''[[His and Her Circumstances]]'' (1998) * '''Kensuke''' - ''[[Ultimate Muscle|Kinnikuman Nisei]] The Movie'' (2002) * '''Dio Eraclea''' - ''[[Last Exile]]'' (2003), ''[[Last Exile -Fam, The Silver Wing-]]'' (2011) * '''Mitsune "Kitsune" Konno''' - ''[[Love Hina]]'' (2000), ''[[Love Hina Again]]'' (2002) * '''Kaori Iba''' - ''[[Maburaho]]'' * '''Eva Wei (Molly)''' - ''[[Oban Star Racers]]'' * '''[[List of One Piece characters#Tashigi|Tashigi]]''', '''[[List of One Piece characters#Franky|Young Franky]]''' - ''[[One Piece]]'' * '''Madoi Iroaya''' & '''Iceman''' - ''[[MegaMan NT Warrior|Rockman.EXE]]'' series * '''Mira Nygus''' - ''[[Soul Eater (manga)#Anime|Soul Eater]]'' * '''Mokkun''' - ''[[Shōnen Onmyōji]]'' * '''Miyuki Rokujou''' - ''[[Strawberry Panic!]]'' (2006) * '''Hinomoto Hikari''' - ''[[Tokimeki Memorial 2]]'' (Video game) * '''[[Zakuro Fujiwara]], [[List of Tokyo Mew Mew characters#Masha|Masha]]''' - ''[[Tokyo Mew Mew]]'' * '''Miwan''' - ''[[Slayers|Slayers NEXT]]'' === Other Voice Roles === * '''[[Xing Cai]]''' in ''[[Dynasty Warriors]] V'' * '''[[Lumine]]''' in ''[[Mega Man X8|Rockman X8]]'' * '''Celsius''', '''Chat''' in ''[[Tales of Eternia]]'' * '''Tarō Sega''' in ''[[Segagaga]]'' == Music == In 2005, Noda provided vocals for an EP with Japanese guitarist [[Jun Senoue]] entitled "Ready!".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wave-master.com/wme/jxj/index.html |title=Wave Master Entertainment entry for JxJ: Ready! |date=2005-03-24 |accessdate=2008-04-11}}</ref> The project is called JxJ (Jun x Junko) and is only available in Japan, though copies have made their way stateside through the Jun Senoue fan page. == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{ann|people|390}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Noda, Junko | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Japanese voice actor | DATE OF BIRTH = June 29, 1971 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Naniwa-ku, Osaka|Naniwa-ku]], [[Osaka, Osaka|Osaka]], [[Osaka Prefecture]], Japan | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Noda, Junko}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Japanese voice actresses]] [[Category:People from Osaka]] [[Category:Japanese female singers]]
